thread.title: David Cameron: "I miss Larry the cat"
thread.title_full: David Cameron: "I miss Larry the cat"

author: Hannah Furness
title: David Cameron: "I miss Larry the cat"
text:
David Cameron: "I miss Larry the cat" David Cameron has admitted he misses the moggy Credit: David Cameron/Twitter Hannah Furness , Arts Correspondent  41pm 
A lthough David Cameron's love for Larry the cat was once cast into doubt after rumours he called the mouser "it", he has revealed that he misses the famous feline. 
The former Prime Minister was talking to The Telegraph at the Oldie of the Year award, where his mother was being awarded a prize when he revealed he missed the territorial puss. 
He said: "I do [miss Larry] a bit actually. He had this habit in the morning of being in my chair. 
"He was so incredibly relaxed that you couldn't really move him. Although actually eventually you had to. 
Despite Theresa May giving Larry the cat a somewhat frosty reception in an interview with The Times and hinting she is more of a dog person, Mr Cameron said he is "sure he's being very well looked-after". The pets of Westminster 
T he former Prime Minister also revealed there "was a lot of cat hair" in Number 10 and that there is a secret picture of Mr Cameron and Larry 
He revealed: "Actually one of the last things I did was take a cat selfie. But I'm going to be saving that one up for my book". 
Larry the cat has two new neighbours; Philip Hammond's dogs, Rex and Oscar. Although terrier Rex is reportedly known for chasing cats, it was revealed to The Telegraph last year that the Chancellor keeps his dogs locked up for fear Larry, who is rather a bruiser, could beat them in a fight. 
Larry and Palmerston, the Foreign Office cat, have recently been seen chasing each other around Downing Street. Watch | Downing Street Cats: Who are Westminster's most important residents? 01:59 
P almerston often looks for Larry by trying to sneak into Number 10. However, after his successful attempt last year, the guards have been able to keep him firmly off the premises. 
Larry, on the other hand, is often seen squeezing under the gates leading to the Foreign Office in pursuit of his playmate. 
Palmerston was unnerved on Tuesday when photographers eager to snap a picture of Boris Johnson on Downing Street ran in his path and terrified him. 
He was pictured streaking off, his territory broached.
